content.text: RPA stands for Robotic Process Automation, though may sound like a lot of complex words joined together, it simply means automating the repetitive tasks we may find in our daily routine.

Imagine you have to copy information from one spreadsheet to a word document every day or send emails to a bunch of people; RPA can do that for you. Itâ€™s almost like an actual robot doing the work for you (but instead of a physical robot, it is a software robot), hence the name Robotic Process Automation.

Take an example of sending personalized emails to a bunch of people who attended your seminar, an RPA bot can do the same work faster, more efficiently and without mistakes. It's like having a helper who never gets tired. Companies use RPA in various areas, like processing invoices, handling customer queries, or managing data entry tasks. Learning RPA is like teaching your computer a few tricks to handle the boring stuff, so you can focus on more exciting things!

title: Things to know before starting journey in Uipath
author: P Praneetha
